definition[0]: to telephone the place where you work, especially in order to report something
example[0]: I’ll phone in and let them know.
example[1]: She phoned in sick (=telephoned to say that she was ill and could not come to work).
example[2]: I’ll phone the report in tomorrow morning.
definition[1]: to telephone a radio or television show to give your opinion or ask a question
example[3]: There’s still time to phone in before the end of the programme.
definition[2]: a radio or television programme in which you hear ordinary people expressing opinions or asking questions over the telephone
